lines.line: Can you please help me? I'm in a terrible spot of trouble.
Aha, sounds like a quest. I'll help.
Yes yes, I suppose it is a quest. My fiance Ernest and I came upon this house.
Seeing as we were a little lost Ernest decided to go in and ask for directions.
That was an hour ago. That house looks spooky, can you go and see if you can find him for me?
Ok, I'll see what I can do.
Thank you, thank you. I'm very grateful.
No, I'm looking for something to kill.
Oooh, you violent person you.
Have you found my sweetheart yet?
No, not yet.
Be careful in here, there's lots of dangerous equipment.
I'm looking for a guy called Ernest.
Ah Ernest, top notch bloke. He's helping me with my experiments.
So you know where he is then?
He's that chicken over there.
Ernest is a chicken...? Are you sure?
Oh, he isn't normally a chicken, or at least he wasn't until he helped me test my pouletmorph machine.
It was originally going to be called a transmutation machine. But after testing pouletmorph seems more appropriate.
I'm glad Veronica didn't actually get engaged to a chicken.
Who's Veronica?
Ernest's fiancee. She probably doesn't want to marry a chicken.
Ooh I dunno. She could have free eggs for breakfast.
I think you'd better change him back.
Umm... It's not so easy...
My machine is broken, and the house gremlins have run off with some vital bits.
Well I can look for them.
That would be a help. They'll be somewhere in the manor house or its grounds, the gremlins never get further than the entrance gate.
I'm missing the pressure gauge and a rubber tube. They've also taken my oil can, which I'm going to need to get this thing started again.
Change him back this instant!
What does this machine do?
Nothing at the moment... It's broken. It's meant to be a transmutation machine.
It has also spent time as a time travel machine, and a dramatic lightning generator, and a thing for generating monsters.
Is this your house?
No, I'm just one of the tenants. It belongs to the count who lives in the basement.
Yes, he's a chicken.
I know he's not exactly brave but I think you're being a bit harsh.
No no, he's been turned into an actual chicken by a mad scientist.
Eeeeeek!
My poor darling, why must these things happen to us.
Well I'm doing my best to turn him back.
Well be quick, I'm sure being a chicken can't be good for him.
Have you found anything yet?
I'm afraid I don't have any of them yet!
I need a rubber tube, a pressure gauge and a can of oil. Then your friend can stop being a chicken.
There seems to be a pressure gauge in here...
Ow!
... and a lot of piranhas! I can't get the gauge out.
... and a lot of dead fish.
It's full of dead fish!
I don't think I want to use that water any more.
I've only got the pressure gauge so far.
It's a good start, but I'll need my oil can and rubber tube too.
Ok, I'll go and look for them.
I have everything!
Give 'em here then.
Thank you. It was dreadfully irritating being a chicken. How can I ever thank you?
Well a cash reward is always nice...
Of course, of course.

characters.name: Veronica
characters.description: Young adult female, British accent, anxious and concerned tone, a worried fiancee who is timid but determined to find her beloved Ernest.

characters.name: Professor Oddenstein
characters.description: Elderly male, eccentric British accent, absent-minded and quirky tone, a mad scientist with wild Einstein-like appearance who is brilliant but socially oblivious.

characters.name: Ernest
characters.description: Young adult male, British accent, polite and grateful tone, a well-mannered gentleman who is relieved to be human again after being transformed into a chicken.
